metadata.title: Thursday, 11th October, 2018
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE TWELFTH ASSEMBLY

questions.section: QUESTIONS FOR ORAL ANSWER (STANDING ORDER NO. 30)
parts: (a) when the construction of health posts in Kaputa District under the 650 Health Posts Project will commence;
(b) how many health posts will be constructed;
(c) where the health posts will be situated; and
(d) what the time frame for the completion of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development and Social Welfare
questions.section: QUESTIONS FOR ORAL ANSWER (STANDING ORDER NO. 30)
parts: (a) what the total number of beneficiaries under the Social Cash Transfer Programme was, as of 30th April, 2018, countrywide;
(b) whether the Government has any plans to increase the number of beneficiaries; and
(c) if so, when the plans will be implemented.

questions.section: QUESTIONS FOR ORAL ANSWER (STANDING ORDER NO. 30)
parts: (a) when the contractor who gravelled the township roads in Mufumbwe District will be paid;
(b) what has caused the delay in paying the contractor; and
(c) when tarring of the roads at (a) will commence.

questions.section: QUESTIONS FOR ORAL ANSWER (STANDING ORDER NO. 30)
parts: (a) whether the payment of annuities to beneficiaries by the Local Authorities Superannuation Fund is up-to-date;
(b) if not, why the payment is not up-to-date;
(c) what the total amount owing is; and
(d) when the outstanding amount will be paid.

questions.section: QUESTIONS FOR ORAL ANSWER (STANDING ORDER NO. 30)
parts: (a) when the tarring of township roads in Kaputa District will commence;
(b) who the contractor for the project is;
(c) when the contract for the project was signed; and
(d) what the time frame for the completion of the project is.

questions.section: QUESTIONS FOR ORAL ANSWER (STANDING ORDER NO. 30)
parts: (a) when the issuance of new national registration cards will commence; and
(b) what additional features and biometric data will be incorporated in the new national registration cards.

questions.section: QUESTIONS FOR ORAL ANSWER (STANDING ORDER NO. 30)
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to deploy additional doctors to Kabompo District Hospital to reduce the critical shortage of doctors;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) how many doctors are earmarked for deployment. ORDER OF THE DAY Supply - Motion (28th September) - Resumption of Debate. ___________________________
